image.altText: An Indigenous man stands in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Over almost 20 years, Indigenous leader Geoff Clark siphoned about $1 million from his community. Here's how the police finally caught him in a story only now able to be told.

title.children: How Operation Omega brought down former ATSIC head Geoff Clark

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.Â

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Moira Deeming's defamation case against Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto has begun in the Federal Court.

title.children: Victorian opposition leader 'tarred' MP with 'the Nazi brush', defamation case hears

image.altText: Aerial vision of a black car with both doors open and a battered front near the middle of an intersection.

props.synopsis: Members of the public have overpowered a man after he allegedly fired a shot, and tried to drag a woman from her car in Doncaster.

title.children: Man placed under citizen's arrest after allegedly firing gun following car crash in Melbourne's east

image.altText: A flag with the letter CFMEU on a building site with an urban backdrop

props.synopsis: An investigation by a prominent barrister has found the CFMEU's construction division was still under the influence of criminal elements, including bikie gangs.

title.children: Report finds CFMEU construction division made 'inadequate' attempts to root out bikies

image.altText: A woman seated in a laboratory wearing a yellow jacket.

props.synopsis: Labor and the Greens are still hashing out whether to include a "climate trigger" that would see proposed resources projects barred if they emit too much atmospheric pollution in the Environmental Protection Authority legislation.

title.children: Albanese rules out 'climate trigger' in nature reforms, but leaves door open for 'climate consideration' compromise

image.altText: A man in an orange t-shirt with his hands behind his back and police officers either side of him.

props.synopsis: The man suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump camped outside a golf course with food and a rifle for nearly 12 hours before he was spotted by the Secret Service, according to court documents.

title.children: Ryan Routh charged with gun crimes after apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: Alleged would-be Trump shooter Ryan Routh

props.synopsis: An investigation into the digital footprint of Donald Trump's alleged would-be assassin Ryan Routh paints a vivid and contradictory picture of his mindset.

title.children: 'You were my choice in [2016]': Trump's alleged would-be assassin's peculiar political leanings

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch and Elena Zhukova Murdoch hold hands as they walk away from a car.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch, his feuding sons and their sisters travel to Nevada for a court hearing over the future of the family's media empire.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch and his warring children take their family feud to court

image.altText: Artist Daniel Richardson and chef Julie Blum.

props.synopsis: Artists with intellectual disabilities are teaming up with Melbourne food icons to turn cherished local recipes into striking artwork.Â

title.children: These unlikely pairings in food and art are bringing cake and other recipes to canvas

image.altText: Composite image of Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The Russian and Chinese economies are lurching into ever more perilous territory, threatening the nations' alliance.

title.children: Isolated on the world stage, Russia turned to China. Now it's suffering from a power imbalance

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: An announcement that 13,700 new homes will be supported through the government's flagship housing fund has come before details have been finalised.

title.children: Federal government unaware on size of social housing spend, with some projects set to take years

image.altText: William Swale at court

props.synopsis: William Herbert Swale is facing a range of charges after the 2023 crash outside a Daylesford pub where five people died.

title.children: Court hears diabetic driver appeared 'vague' before crash that killed five

image.altText: A sculpture of a face and head with red lips and the skill absent showing the outline of a brain

props.synopsis: Many of the risk factors for dementia â being female, growing older and the genetic lottery â cannot be avoided. But research is uncovering a growing list of ways to cut your risk.

title.children: The 14 risk factors to watch for as dementia cases set to skyrocket

image.altText: fire bruning in paddock, lots of smoke

props.synopsis: Authorities are urging anyone in the North Plantations area of Carnarvon to monitor conditions.

title.children: Bushfire in Carnarvon downgraded from 'emergency' to 'advice'

image.altText: Exposed timber beams inside a house which is under construction.

props.synopsis: It's not just Australian home owners who are being left to struggle as large numbers of builders go bust. Contractors, too, are facing hefty losses.

title.children: 'Big red flags': This couple have been left with an incomplete house after their builder went bust

image.altText: Three ducks stand in snow

props.synopsis: Temperatures across south-east Australia have plummeted during the past 48 hours, leading to the coldest spring weather in decades.

title.children: Record spring cold snap delivers snow and severe frost to south-east Australia

image.altText: Police outside a nightclub

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries following an alleged attack at a 24-hour nightclub.

title.children: Police hunt for attackers after alleged stabbing at Melbourne's Revolver Upstairs

image.altText: A man with an angry expression looks on

props.synopsis: The former long-time face of the BBC's flagship news program, who announced Queen Elizabeth's death on air in 2022, is given a suspended sentence at a London court on Monday after admitting to making indecent images of children.

title.children: Former BBC presenter Huw Edwards avoids jail over making indecent images of children

image.altText: Charlotte Wood, a 59-year-old woman with cropped grey hair, smiles, while standing in a well-lit doorway.

props.synopsis: Charlotte Wood is shortlisted for her 10th book, Stone Yard Devotional, a novel about a woman who leaves her life in the city to join an enclosed religious community.

title.children: Charlotte Wood becomes first Australian shortlisted for $100k Booker Prize in decade

image.altText: A sign at the entrance of Mt Atkinson

props.synopsis: Residents in Mt Atkinson say rideshares regularly cancel, mail is left at post offices half an hour away and hospital allocations have become a headache.

title.children: Cancelled Ubers and hospital confusion â why this outer-Melbourne community wants its own suburb

image.altText: Ken Hinkley speaking to Hawthorn players after AFL semifinal.

props.synopsis: The AFL comes down hard on Port Adelaide following Power coach Ken Hinkley's heated exchange with Hawthorn players following Friday night's semifinal.

title.children: AFL fines Power $20,000 after Hinkley's confrontation with Hawks

image.altText: A digital collage of a bald man sitting holding a glass of wine, with hand tattoos. Behind, holes are punched in a background.

props.synopsis: For three weeks, police recorded as a group allegedly orchestrated the murder of Alen Moradian â one of Australia's most feared organised crime figures.

title.children: For three weeks a group was recorded allegedly plotting to kill this man. Why didn't police stop them?

image.altText: A rescuer walks across floodwaters

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in Central Europe continues to rise as thousands of people are evacuated from their homes.Â

title.children: Deadly flooding in Central Europe devastates Romania, Czechia and Poland

image.altText: A man sits with glasses on

props.synopsis: Tito Jackson, the third of nine Jackson children, including global superstars Michael and Janet, has died.

title.children: Tito Jackson, member of The Jackson 5, dies aged 70

image.altText: An actress stands on stage in a black dress holding an Emmy statue at a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian actress Elizabeth Debicki has won an Emmy for her role as Princess Diana in The Crown. This and other highlights from the 76th Emmy awards.

title.children: Elizabeth Debicki wins Emmy for playing Princess Diana in The Crown

image.altText: A split image with one AFLW Crows player being helped off the ground (left) and a Bulldogs player looking sad after a game.

props.synopsis: Adelaide premiership forward Eloise Jones and Western Bulldogs midfield star Ellie Blackburn will miss the rest of the AFLW season because of injuries.

title.children: Season over for star AFLW duo after in-game injuries

image.altText: A composite image of close up shots of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Last week the prime minister finally sounded like he was setting the agenda rather than constantly dodging hits, but a question from the US presidential debate could prove dangerous closer to the election.

title.children: There's one question from the US debate that could prove dangerous in Australia's next election

image.altText: An older woman in an armchair with a health professional next to her, surrounded by ghost-like people

props.synopsis: Hospitalised in a public health psychiatric unit 30 times in six years, Christine wants urgent change to the mental health system. Her photographs re-imagined mental health conditions; now she is adamant her voice should be heard.

title.children: Christine's photographs captured 'invisible' mental illness. Then she had her own breakdown

image.altText: An Australian women's tennis player (L) and her Polish opponent stand together on a tennis court holding trophies after a final.

props.synopsis: Australian Olivia Gadecki's run from Guadalajara qualifying ends in a close loss in the final to Poland's Magdalena FrÄch.

title.children: Aussie Olivia Gadecki's big move despite tense Mexican WTA final loss

image.altText: Frances Rodger and her husband Ed, and their cat in a selfie photo, Tamworth, 2024.

props.synopsis: The silence around menopause has long been the norm in rural Australia â now a new generation of women are trying to reshape attitudes and services around this normal, natural phase of life.Â

title.children: 'Two years in the wilderness' could have been solved by the right menopause care, but still regional women suffer in silence

image.altText: A man looks into the camera with a solemn expression, in a portrait taken in a park.

props.synopsis: In 2015, ASIC warned Australia's banks to watch out for an overseas investment scam and take action to prevent people falling victim to it. Months later, David Sweeney's father lost $1 million to the very same scheme.

title.children: David's father lost $1 million to an overseas scam. Months earlier, banks were told to block it

image.altText: Sarah Roberts takes a selfie on the beach

props.synopsis: Missing out on parenthood can cause a "deep existential crisis", and understanding that we hold different reproductive identities can help us be more sensitive about childlessness.Â

title.children: 'At least you get to sleep in': The comments that can unintentionally minimise childlessness

image.altText: Two young girls wearing pony tails and green uniforms smile at their desks, one with a MacBook and the other handwriting.

props.synopsis: Specialised year 9 programs are designed to help students get through the "lost year" in education through outdoor challenges and rites of passage.

title.children: Year 9 is often referred to as the 'lost year' amid hormones and puberty, but this school gives students their own campus

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: Robert and Anne Geeves are found not guilty of murder, following a long trial held more than 20 years after Ms Haigh's disappearance in 2002.

title.children: Couple not guilty of murdering 19-year-old mum Amber Haigh
